definition: abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]

sentences.english: You can read a book anywhere, any time.
sentences.chinese: 但書，你可以隨時隨地的翻閱。

sentences.english: The provision in the second paragraph is applied to the proviso in the first paragraph.
sentences.chinese: 前條第二項之規定，於本條第一項但書情形準用之。

sentences.english: But books, like cats, have nine lives.
sentences.chinese: 但書就像貓一樣，有九條命。

sentences.english: Registration of the cancellation according to the provision of the proviso of Article 147.
sentences.chinese: 一一依第一百四十七條但書規定之塗銷登記。

sentences.english: I agree to do the job , with one proviso - that i ' m paid in advance.
sentences.chinese: 我同意做這項工作，但有一個但書工資預付。

definition: to spread falsehoods/to increasingly distort the truth/to pile errors on top of errors (idiom)
to change (sth)/to alter (sth)/to change over (to sth else)
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
pragmatic/flexible/to act differently in different situations/to accommodate to circumstances
lit. to chop the nail and slice the iron (idiom)/fig. resolute and decisive/unhesitating/categorical
to transcribe/to make a fair copy
to make a show of being original or unconventional (idiom)
